title: Sync Audiences Response
description: Response from audience sync operation. Returns either per-audience results OR operation-level errors.

oneOf.title: SyncAudiencesSuccess
oneOf.description: Success response - sync operation processed audiences

audiences.description: Results for each audience on the account

audience_id.description: Audience ID from the request (buyer's identifier)

seller_id.description: Seller-assigned identifier for this audience in their ad platform

action.description: Action taken for this audience. 'status' is present when action is created, updated, or unchanged. 'status' is absent when action is deleted or failed.

status.description: Matching status. Present when action is created, updated, or unchanged; absent when action is deleted or failed. 'processing': platform is still matching members against its user base. 'ready': audience is available for targeting, matched_count is populated. 'too_small': matched audience is below the platform's minimum size â€” add more members and re-sync.

uploaded_count.description: Number of members submitted in this sync operation (delta, not cumulative). In discovery-only calls (no audiences array), this is 0.

matched_count.description: Total members matched to platform users across all syncs (cumulative, not just this call). Populated when status is 'ready'.

last_synced_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the most recent sync operation was accepted by the platform. Useful for agents reasoning about audience freshness. Omitted if the seller does not track this.

minimum_size.description: Minimum matched audience size required for targeting on this platform. Populated when status is 'too_small'. Helps agents know how many more members are needed.

errors.description: Errors for this audience (only present when action='failed')

items.title: Error
items.description: Standard error structure for task-specific errors and warnings

field.description: Field path associated with the error (e.g., 'packages[0].targeting')

retry_after.description: Seconds to wait before retrying the operation

sandbox.description: When true, this response contains simulated data from sandbox mode.

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

items.title: Error
items.description: Standard error structure for task-specific errors and warnings

field.description: Field path associated with the error (e.g., 'packages[0].targeting')

retry_after.description: Seconds to wait before retrying the operation

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

_bundled.note: This is a bundled schema with all $ref resolved inline. For the modular version with references, use the parent directory.
